metadata.title: CVE-2020-24614 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Fossil before 2.10.2, 2.11.x before 2.11.2, and 2.12.x before 2.12.1 allows remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary code. An attacker must have check-in privileges on the repository.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-24614` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fossil - 1:2.12.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fossil package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.12.1-1').
